src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.create_score module

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.create_score.compute_score_value(sdc_score, match_sub_df, freq, n_det, n_rej)[source]

Compute the per-match accuracy and generate the final score report.

Parameters

  • submission_metadata (SubmissionMetadata) – Identifies the submission catalogue location and metadata

  • n_det (int) – The total number of detected sources in the submission

  • match_sub_df (pd.DataFrame) – The sieved matches that are below the multi_d threshold

  • beam_size (float) – The beam_size, used to calculate the positional accuracy

  • n_rej (int) – Number of candidate matches rejected on the basis of multi_d

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.create_score.create_sdc_score(sieved_sub_df, freq, n_det, mode, train, detail)[source]

Complete the scoring pipeline using the data generated by the previous steps. This requires the (sieved) candidate match catalogue created from the crossmatch step.

Parameters

  • sieved_sub_df (pandas.DataFrame) – The processed and sieved candidate match catalogue between submission and truth.

  • freq (int) – The current frequency value.

  • n_det (int) – Total number of detected sources.

  • mode (int) – 0 or 1 to use core or centroid positions for scoring

  • train (bool) – Whether the score is determined based on training area only

  • detail (bool) – If True, will include the detailed score and match data with the returned Sdc1Score object.

Returns

The calculated SDC1 score

object

Return type

ska_sdc.sdc1.models.sdc1_score.Sdc1Score

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep module

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep.calculate_conv_size(cat_df, freq_value)[source]

Calculate convolved size; this is necessary to control for the potentially small Gaussian source sizes, which could yield an unrepresentative positional accuracy.

Thus we calculate the apparent size by convolving with the beam size.

Parameters

  • cat_df (pd.DataFrame) – The catalogue DataFrame for which to calculate the convolved size

  • freq_value (int) – The current frequency value

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep.calculate_log_flux(cat_df)[source]

Create new log(flux) column

Parameters

cat_df (pd.DataFrame) – The catalogue DataFrame for which to calculate log(flux)

Calculate the primary beam (PB) values via intermediary pd.Series

Parameters

  • cat_df (pd.DataFrame) – The catalogue DataFrame for which to exclude the training area and calculate new features

  • freq_value (int) – The current frequency value

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep.clean_catalogue(cat_df)[source]

Remove bad values from the passed catalogue DataFrame. Sources with a NaN value, or negative value of flux, b_min, b_maj or core_frac will be dropped.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep.drop_negatives(cat_df, col_name)[source]

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.prep.refine_area(cat_df, freq_value, train=False)[source]

Crop the dataframe by area to exclude or include the training area.

The training area limits are different for each frequency.

Parameters

  • cat_df (pd.DataFrame) – The catalogue DataFrame for which to refine the area

  • freq_value (int) – The current frequency value

  • train (bool) – True to include only the training area, False to exclude the training area

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper module

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.correct_size_s(size_s, size_id_s, size_id_t_s)[source]

Given the size measurements in size_s, for objects that are incorrectly classified in size_id_s (based on the true values in size_id_t_s), correct the apparent sizes using defined correction factors.

Size classification is as follows:

1 - Largest Angular Scale (LAS) 2 - Gaussian FWHM 3 - Exponential

Parameters

  • size_s (pd.Series) – Measured size (b_maj or b_min) series.

  • size_id_s (pd.Series) – Measured size class series.

  • size_id_t_s (pd.Series) – True size class series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_b_min_scores(b_min_acc_s, size_id_t_s)[source]

Compute the b_min size scores; this differs from b_maj as b_min is not clearly defined for steep-spectrum AGN. Scores for this class of object are set to SCORE_MAX.

Parameters

  • b_min_acc_s (pd.Series) – Size accuracy (b_min) series.

  • size_id_t_s (pd.Series) – True size ID series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_class_acc_series(class_s, class_t_s)[source]

Calculate classification accuracy series; this is simply 0 or 1 for each source.

Parameters

  • class_s (pd.Series) – Predicted class series.

  • class_t_s (pd.Series) – True class series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_core_frac_acc_series(core_frac_s, core_frac_t_s)[source]

Calculate core fraction accuracy series based on measured and truth values. The mean core fraction for unresolved AGN is 0.75.

Parameters

  • core_frac_s (pd.Series) – Measured core fraction series.

  • core_frac_t_s (pd.Series) – True core fraction series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_pa_acc_series(pa_s, pa_t_s)[source]

Calculate position angle (PA) accuracy series based on measured and truth values, after correcting for angle degeneracies.

Parameters

  • pa_s (pd.Series) – Measured PA series.

  • pa_t_s (pd.Series) – True corresponding PA series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_pa_scores(pa_acc_s, size_id_t_s)[source]

Compute the position angle scores; as with b_min this is not clearly defined for steep-spectrum AGN. Scores for this class of object are set to SCORE_MAX.

Parameters

  • pa_acc_s (pd.Series) – Position angle accuracy series.

  • size_id_t_s (pd.Series) – True size ID series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_pos_acc_series(ra_s, dec_s, ra_t_s, dec_t_s, b_maj_t_s, b_min_t_s, beam_size)[source]

Calculate positional accuracy series based on passed measured and truth values.

Parameters

  • ra_s (pd.Series) – Measured RA series.

  • dec_s (pd.Series) – Measured Dec series.

  • ra_t_s (pd.Series) – True RA series.

  • dec_t_s (pd.Series) – True Dec series.

  • b_maj_t_s (pd.Series) – True major axis series, to estimate source size.

  • b_min_t_s (pd.Series) – True minor axis series, to estimate source size.

  • beam_size (float) – The primary beam size

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_position_scores(core_acc_series, cent_acc_series)[source]

Compute the position scores; take the closest match out of core and centroid accuracies, and calculate the score, weighted by the set position threshold value.

The maximum score per source is SCORE_MAX

Parameters

  • core_acc_series (pd.Series) – Positional accuracy (core) series.

  • cent_acc_series (pd.Series) – Positional accuracy (centroid) series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.score_helper.get_size_acc_series(size_s, size_t_s, size_id_s, size_id_t_s)[source]

Calculate size accuracy series based on measured and truth values, after correcting for incorrect size classification.

Parameters

  • size_s (pd.Series) – Measured size (b_maj or b_min) series.

  • size_t_s (pd.Series) – True corresponding size series.

  • size_id_s (pd.Series) – Measured size class series.

  • size_id_t_s (pd.Series) – True size class series.

src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.sdc1_xmatch module

class src.scoring.ska_sdc.sdc1.utils.sdc1_xmatch.Sdc1XMatch(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: KDTreeXMatch

Crossmatch sources for the SDC1 scoring use case.

crossmatch_kdtree()[source]

Explicit declaration of super class method

get_all_col()[source]

Get the column names in truth and submitted catalogues which should be stored in the output candidate match dataframe

get_kdtree()[source]

Get the point K-D tree object. This is constructed using the positions (RA/Dec) of sources in the truth catalogue.

The mode attribute tells the XMatch whether to use core or centroid positions.

Returns

k-dimensional tree space partitioning data structure.

Return type

sklearn.neighbors.KDTree

get_query_coords()[source]

Get the submitted catalogue positions to query the KDTree.

The mode attribute tells the XMatch whether to use core or centroid positions.

Returns

The submitted catalogue coordinate pairs, used to query the KDTree.

Return type

numpy.array

get_radius_arr()[source]

Get the size array that sets the maximum distance a submitted source can lie from a truth source to be considered a candidate match. In the SDC1 case this is the convolved size of the submitted source.

refine_match_df(cand_match_df)[source]

Rename size column to size_id for clarity
